content.description: On the tall South face, sit start near the middle of the face on the far right side of a downward leaning rail. Climb up via a delicate undercling or thin crimp to a horrible left hand notch. Pull up to a good sidepull far to the right, get your feet high and pull a sketchy move to a good hold. The rest of the climbing is much easier but the jugs are not obvious to spot and you're pretty high up there.
content.location: Near the Center of the South face of Cattle Drive rock starting on the far right of a downward sloping rail.

content.description: Start just right of the slick sloping ramp and work your way up the left leaning suttle arete on slopers, crimps and jugs.
content.location: On the far right side of the large South face of Cattle Drive Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on sloping rail and pull on large holds up the crack feature. Top out is a little dirty but lower angle than the other routes.
content.location: Just right of the diagonal arete that separates the faces, to the left of Last Resort

content.description:
Cow Tipping is the easiest route that heads up the overhang on the uphill side of Cattle Drive Rock.  Find something to get yourself off the ground (which can be tricky), and move yourself up and over the roof.

Almost everything in and around the roof is loose. Losing a hand while pulling the roof requires some good padding and spotting.  Losing a foot will probably require some reconstructive facial surgury.
content.protection: A pad or two is wise for the lower section, once over the roof bring a crew to catch you in case you blow a hand or foot.

content.description: Cattle Drive traverses the rock starting to the far right on the East side of the rock. Start on a series of sidepulls and jugs and round the corner to the ridiculously slick ramp. Next, low ball traverse across the face on balancy rails and a perplexing series of holds. Top out on the arete for the V1+ version or round the corner on the big rail down low and make your way across the face to the crack and finish on Cow Tipping for the full V3 version. Continuing around the corner to the low angle face instead of topping out on Cow Tipping is the more popular version and is still V3.
content.protection: A pad or two may be wise for some as a balancy part sits right over a REALLY sharp rock.
